text: That shot looks much better now.

Your application response was decent but next time be more specific. You could have added something like *'The Alienist was a particular show that I thought had great vfx. The set extension work the Freefolk did on this was so impressive, I would have loved to have been part of this team and be able to learn from them.'*
I saw that Framestore are switching their launchpad scheme to be remote. I think that's a shame as you'll learn a lot more being in a room with people. Still worth applying though.

Along with your CV and reel it's always worth sending an email or if there is an option a cover letter. This helps to cement that you're really keen to be there and makes the recruiter feel like you're particularly keen on their company. I spoke to Ollie Gilmour who is our recruitment guy. Unfortunately all our internships are on hold until things settle, and we don't think remote internships would benefit anyone. However he said to get in touch and send your stuff over so we can get you on our books for when things get back to normal.
His contact is <mailto:ollieg@electrictheatre.tv|ollieg@electrictheatre.tv> feel free to say you've been mentored by me and I told you to get in touch.
